thread.title: Barcelona 4-2 Valencia player ratings: Messi double keeps Catalans in the title hunt
thread.title_full: Barcelona 4-2 Valencia player ratings: Messi double keeps Catalans in the title hunt

author: mirror
title: Barcelona 4-2 Valencia player ratings: Messi double keeps Catalans in the title hunt
text:
Messi was again the saviour for Barcelona (Photo:   
Barcelona just about kept in touching distance of Real Madrid going into the international break with a 4-2 victory against Valencia at the Camp Nou. 
But it was far from easy, even though the visitors were forced to play much of the game with ten men after goalscorer Eliquim Mangala was sent off for denying Luis Suarez a goal-scoring opportunity. 
From the resultant penalty, Lionel Messi scored the first of his two goals to put Barca ahead after Luis Suarez had cancelled out Mangala's opener. 
But Valencia immediately returned fire with Munir El Haddadi scoring at the other end seconds later. 
In the second half, the Catalans were far from their best - but made their man advantage count, with Messi scoring an excellent second before Andre Gomes put the icing on the cake with a goal against his former team. 
Read on for all our Barca player ratings from the Camp Nou. Luis Suarez celebrates his goal against Valencia (Photo: AFP) Read More Barcelona 4-2 Valencia: Lionel Messi scores twice as Luis Enrique's side close gap on Real Madrid - 5 things we learned   (Photo: AFP) 
  
  Lionel Messi wreaks havoc on the Valencia defence (Photo: Getty) 
  Suarez had one of his best games of the season, even if Barca were far from vintage (Photo: REUTERS) 
Neymar   Neymar had a good game even though he didn't score (Photo: AFP) 
Subs
